articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An Israeli air strike at a medical clinic in Gaza City killed the director of Gaza's Ambulance and Emergency Department, the enclave's health ministry said, while Israel's military said the strike had killed a senior Hamas armed commander.
articles.title: Israel kills senior Gaza health official, tanks push deeper into Rafah

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: The Kremlin on Monday directly blamed the United States for an attack on Crimea with U.S.-supplied ATACMS missiles that killed at least four people and injured 151, and Moscow formally warned the U.S. ambassador that retaliation would follow.
articles.title: Russia vows retaliation against US for Ukraine's ATACMS missile attack on Crimea

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday will emphasize to Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant the importance of Israel swiftly developing a robust and realistic plan for the governance of Gaza for when the war is over, the U.S. State Department said.
articles.title: US says Blinken will emphasize to Israel's Gallant the need for post-war Gaza plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron told a podcast episode shown on Monday that both the far right National Rally (RN) party and the left-wing New Popular Front coalition - front runners in the parliamentary election- risked bringing "civil war" to France.
articles.title: Macron warns podcast of 'civil war' risk as French elections loom

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire broke out at a lithium battery manufacturing plant in South Korea on Monday, fire officials said, and Yonhap news agency reported that some 20 bodies had been found inside the factory.
articles.title: Fire breaks out at South Korea battery plant, 20 bodies found, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Dagestan began three days of mourning of Monday after gunmen killed multiple police officers, an Orthodox priest and several others in attacks on synagogues and churches on Sunday across two cities in the North Caucasus region.
articles.title: Russia's Dagestan mourns priest, police killed in attack by gunmen

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. State Department on Monday said a video of a wounded Palestinian man strapped on a military jeep by Israeli forces was "shocking" and urged a swift investigation to hold those responsible to account.
articles.title: US shocked by video of wounded Palestinian tied to Israeli military jeep

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres accused Israel on Monday of spreading misinformation about him during the more than eight-month-long war between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas in the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Without naming names, UN chief accuses Israel of misinformation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union will downgrade political contacts with Georgia and consider freezing financial aid to the government after it pushed through a controversial "foreign agent" law, EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said on Monday.
articles.title: EU to downgrade Georgia ties and mull finance freeze, Borrell says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Portuguese Prime Minister Antonio Costa, a front-runner to become the next president of the European Council, said on Monday he was optimistic ahead of the bloc's summit this week during which a decision on the top job is expected to be made.
articles.title: Former Portuguese PM 'optimistic' as EU Council top job decision nears
